interesting_fact: India has the world's second-largest population.
The United States was the first country to land humans on the moon.
Japan has the world's oldest company, which has been operating since 578 AD.
Brazil is home to the Amazon rainforest, the largest in the world.
Australia is home to the Great Barrier Reef, the largest coral reef system in the world.
Russia spans 11 time zones, the most of any country in the world.
Canada has the world's longest coastline, stretching over 202,080 kilometers.
South Africa has three capital cities: Pretoria, Cape Town, and Bloemfontein.
China has the largest population in the world.
The Eiffel Tower in Paris was originally intended to be a temporary structure.
